intro: Sida leprosa, commonly known as the leprosy plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a rough texture. Sida leprosa is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes found in agricultural areas.
